item.title: Reply to 'How to stop a running *.JAR file with a batch script?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1563029/how-to-stop-a-running-jar-file-with-a-batch-script:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'How to stop a running *.JAR file with a batch script?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1563029/how-to-stop-a-running-jar-file-with-a-batch-script:

Have your app create a temp file on startup and periodically check if it still exists. Your batch script can just delete that file to terminate the app.
